snippet: Ordered to repay about $9,600, Culture Secretary Maria Miller had a moment of contrition last week in Parliament, where she made a formal apology after over-claiming her expenses.
abstract: Britain's Culture Secretary Maria Miller continues to sustain avalanche of criticism for over-claiming expenses and offering what some say was an insufficient apology; scandal has become mini-crisis for Prime Min David Cameron.
lead_paragraph: Ordered to repay about $9,600, Culture Secretary Maria Miller had a moment of contrition last week in Parliament, where she made a formal apology after over-claiming her expenses.

headline.main: Britain: A Moment of Contrition Compounds Problems for a Minister
headline.print_headline: Britain: A Moment of Contrition Compounds Problems for a Minister
